items.content_text: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

items.title: NASA Welcomes Oman as Newest Artemis Accords Signatory - NASA
items.content_text: The Sultanate of Oman signed the Artemis Accords during a ceremony in Muscat attended by NASA on Monday, becoming the 61st nation to commit to responsible

items.title: NASA Technology Brings Golden Age of Exploration to Earth - NASA
items.content_text: As NASA fosters technologies needed to live and work farther away from home than ever before, the agency’s Technology Transfer program has the sole mission of

items.title: NASA Sets Briefings for SpaceX Crew-12 Mission to Space Station - NASA
items.content_text: Next, the crew of NASA’s SpaceX Crew-12 mission will participate in a virtual news conference from NASA Johnson crew quarters at 1 p.m., also on the agency’s

items.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
items.content_text: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

items.title: Space Physics, Cardiac Research Kickoff Last Week in January - NASA
items.content_text: Space physics and cardiac research kicked off the week aboard the International Space Station for the three-person Expedition 74 crew. The orbital residents explored storing cryogenic fluids in space and how their cardiovascular system is adapting to weightlessness.

items.title: How NASA Is Homing in From Space on Ocean Debris
items.content_text: Space-based technology could help track plastic and other flotsam by its ‘fingerprints.’

items.title: NASA Reveals New Details About Dark Matter’s Influence on Universe
items.content_text: With the Webb telescope’s unprecedented sensitivity, scientists are learning more about dark matter’s influence on stars, galaxies, and even planets like Earth.

items.title: NASA’s SunRISE SmallSats Ace Tests, Moving Closer to Launch
items.content_text: The small satellites passed a crucible of tests, ending with a simulation of the intense vibrations of launch.

items.title: NASA’s SPHEREx Observatory Completes First Cosmic Map Like No Other
items.content_text: The telescope will help scientists answer big-picture questions about everything from water deposits in the Milky Way to what happened in the first second after the big bang.

items.title: NASA’s Perseverance Mars Rover Ready to Roll for Miles in Years Ahead
items.content_text: The rover has been acing a long-term series of durability tests, making the most of its enhanced navigation capabilities, and ferreting out new findings about Mars’ geologic past.

items.title: NASA Study Suggests Saturn’s Moon Titan May Not Have Global Ocean
items.content_text: Reanalysis of data from NASA’s Cassini mission has revealed Saturn’s moon may instead have layers of slush with isolated pockets of liquid water.

items.title: NASA JPL Shakes Things Up Testing Future Commercial Lunar Spacecraft
items.content_text: As Firefly Aerospace prepares to follow its successful soft landing on the Moon, an engineering model for its next lander is being put through its paces.

items.title: One of NASA’s Key Cameras Orbiting Mars Takes 100,000th Image
items.content_text: Mesas and dunes stand out in the view snapped by HiRISE, one of the imagers aboard the agency’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter.

items.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
items.content_text: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

items.title: December 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: As we start the new year, here’s a look at key Terran R program milestones from December 2025.    Design  This month, the team released 1,526 flight parts and the integrated thrust structure fluids assembly, unlocking downstream manufacturing and keeping the integration schedule moving at p

items.title: November 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. items.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
items.content_text: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites

items.title: October 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch.
